Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous substance, with remains of at least six lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, now faded and worn in places.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393209) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393209)
